messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Different therapies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/3/1 1:27:47 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes: ),
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/3/1 1:27:47 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
writes:

<<Anyone else swear by color therapy, aromatherapy
(aside from manure<g>), reiki, infant massage?
It would be an interesting topic to hear about, and
how you teach it to your kids....
-Bobbie
>>
I am so behind on these posts! I just wanted to say to the above- yes, yes,
yes, and yes- and any other natural forms of healing/therapy... out there on
the earth that go along with body, mind, spirit, nature. I'm also an
intuitive/spiritual/psychic healer. (I never know what to "call" it-it is
all of these things and more- all I know is that it works and I feel very
blessed to be able to do it!).

There aren't any natural healing modalities that I can think of off the top
that I've seen or heard of that are harmful, and as with anything, all
therapies need to be done with thought and care. I respect all natural forms
of healing and energy work. Not a big fan of allopathic medicine! Can you
tell?!

Vic
